metadata.title: CVE-2016-9067 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Two use-after-free errors during DOM operations resulting in potentiallyexploitable crashes. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 50.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
